intro: Trollius altaicus subsp. altaicus, commonly known as the Altai buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Altai Mountains region. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers with 5-7 petals. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces achenes as its fruit. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems.
